speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: SCENE XII. Another part of the same.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Enter MARK ANTONY and SCARUS

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Yet they are not join'd: where yond pine

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: does stand,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I shall discover all: I'll bring thee word

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Straight, how 'tis like to go.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: Swallows have built

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: In Cleopatra's sails their nests: the augurers

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: Say they know not, they cannot tell; look grimly,

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: And dare not speak their knowledge. Antony

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: Is valiant, and dejected; and, by starts,

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: His fretted fortunes give him hope, and fear,

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: Of what he has, and has not.

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: Alarum afar off, as at a sea-fight

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: Re-enter MARK ANTONY

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: All is lost;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: My fleet hath yielded to the foe; and yonder

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: They cast their caps up and carouse together

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Like friends long lost. Triple-turn'd whore!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: 'tis thou

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Makes only wars on thee. Bid them all fly;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For when I am revenged upon my charm,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I have done all. Bid them all fly; begone.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exit SCARUS

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: O sun, thy uprise shall I see no more:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Fortune and Antony part here; even here

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Do we shake hands. All come to this? The hearts

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That spaniel'd me at heels, to whom I gave

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Their wishes, do discandy, melt their sweets

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: On blossoming Caesar; and this pine is bark'd,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That overtopp'd them all. Betray'd I am:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: O this false soul of Egypt! this grave charm,--

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Whose eye beck'd forth my wars, and call'd them home;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Whose bosom was my crownet, my chief end,--

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Like a right gipsy, hath, at fast and loose,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Beguiled me to the very heart of loss.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: What, Eros, Eros!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter CLEOPATRA

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Ah, thou spell! Avaunt!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Why is my lord enraged against his love?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And blemish Caesar's triumph. Let him take thee,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Follow his chariot, like the greatest spot

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Of all thy sex; most monster-like, be shown

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For poor'st diminutives, for doits; and let

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Patient Octavia plough thy visage up

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: With her prepared nails.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exit CLEOPATRA

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: 'Tis well thou'rt gone,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: If it be well to live; but better 'twere

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Thou fell'st into my fury, for one death

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Might have prevented many. Eros, ho!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The shirt of Nessus is upon me: teach me,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Alcides, thou mine ancestor, thy rage:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Let me lodge Lichas on the horns o' the moon;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And with those hands, that grasp'd the heaviest club,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Subdue my worthiest self. The witch shall die:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To the young Roman boy she hath sold me, and I fall

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Under this plot; she dies for't. Eros, ho!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exit
